datafield.subfield: Northeastern Conference of Seventh-day Adventists, N.Y.
Teachers' perceptions of the availability and need of a support program for students with learning difficulties attending elementary schools in the Atlantic Union Conference, c2013:

t.p. (Lileth Althea Coke, Ph.D. from Andrews University, Mich.) leaf 208 (B.S. in Elementary Education from Atlantic Union College, Mass., 1996; M.A. in School Administration, Atlantic Union College, Mass., in 1999; teacher, Oakview Prep. School, New York, 1996-1998; teacher and assistant principal, R.T. Hudson School, New York, 1998-2009; church administrator, Northeastern Conference of Seventh-day Adventists, New York, 2009- ; address: 4031 De Reimer Ave., Bronx, N.Y. 10466; email: lacoke@northeastern.org)

Lileth Althea Coke graduated with B.S. in Elementary Education from Atlantic Union College, Mass. in 1996. She finished her M.A. in School Administration from Atlantic Union College in 1999. She completed her Ph.D. in Curriculum and Instruction from Andrews University, Mich. in 2013. She taught at Oakview Prep. School in New York from 1996 to 1998. She served as assistant principal and teacher at R.T. Hudson School also in New York from 1998 to 2009. She has served as administrator at the Education Department of Northeastern Conference of Seventh-day Adventists, New York since 2009.
